Package mainPackage

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • mainPackage.Rule

  • public class Rule
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines the rules of the game, such as the number of cards per player and the effects of the cards.
    Author:
    Benjamin Héroult

    • Method Detail

      • cardPerPlayer

        public static int cardPerPlayer​(int nb_players,
                                int nb_jeux)
        Choose how many cards must be given to each player at the beginning of the game. Based on the rules defined on the Wikipedia page "8 américain", part 7 : "Variantes".
        Parameters:
        nb_players - number of players in the game (2 to 6)
        nb_jeux - number of group of cards in the game (1 or 2, so 52 or 104 cards)
        Returns:
        the number of cards each player musts receive

      • chooseRule

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> chooseRule​(int numRule)
        Defines on witch rule the game will be based, using numRules.
        Parameters:
        numRule - number of the rule chosen
        Returns:
        the map collection of effects applied in the game associated to their card(s)

      • getCardStopAttack

        public static java.lang.String getCardStopAttack​()
        Give access to the card that can stop an attack, if it exists.
        Returns:
        the name of the card witch can stop an attack

      • minimale

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> minimale​()
        Creates the map collection of the effects for the minimal version
        Returns:
        the map collection of the cards with the effects associated

      • monclar

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> monclar​()
        Creates the map collection of the effects for the "Monclar" version
        Returns:
        the map collection of the cards with the effects associated
